segment.source: Edit the Configuration.mof File
segment.target: Edit the Configuration.mof File

segment.source: Edit the Configuration.mof File
segment.target: Edit the Configuration.mof File

segment.source: Edit the Configuration.mof File
segment.target: Edit the Configuration.mof File

segment.source: To enable the client computers to report BitLocker compliance details through the MBAM Configuration Manager reports, you have to edit the Configuration.mof file, whether you are using Configuration Manager 2007 or System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: To enable the client computers to report BitLocker compliance details through the MBAM Configuration Manager reports, you have to edit the Configuration.mof file, whether you are using Configuration Manager 2007 or System Center 2012 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Complete the following instructions for the version of Configuration Manager that you are using.
segment.target: Complete the following instructions for the version of Configuration Manager that you are using.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you are installing Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 Service Pack 1 (SP1), either by doing a new installation or by upgrading from a previous version, see the appropriate item in About MBAM 2.0 SP1 as described in the following bullets:
segment.target: If you are installing Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) 2.0 Service Pack 1 (SP1), either by doing a new installation or by upgrading from a previous version, see the appropriate item in About MBAM 2.0 SP1 as described in the following bullets:

segment.source: For a new MBAM 2.0 SP1 installation, see Required files for installing MBAM 2.0 SP1 if you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For a new MBAM 2.0 SP1 installation, see Required files for installing MBAM 2.0 SP1 if you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For an upgrade to MBAM 2.0 SP1, see Update the configuration.mof file if you upgrade to MBAM 2.0 SP1 and you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007.
segment.target: For an upgrade to MBAM 2.0 SP1, see Update the configuration.mof file if you upgrade to MBAM 2.0 SP1 and you are using MBAM with Configuration Manager 2007.

segment.source: To create the configuration.mof file if you are using MBAM 2.0 SP1 with Configuration Manager
segment.target: To create the configuration.mof file if you are using MBAM 2.0 SP1 with Configuration Manager

segment.source: See the “Important” note about MBAM 2.0 SP1 earlier in this topic for the appropriate instructions to follow in About MBAM 2.0 SP1.
segment.target: See the “Important” note about MBAM 2.0 SP1 earlier in this topic for the appropriate instructions to follow in About MBAM 2.0 SP1.

segment.source: To edit the Configuration.mof file for System Center 2012 Configuration Manager
segment.target: To edit the Configuration.mof file for System Center 2012 Configuration Manager

segment.source: On the Configuration Manager Server, browse to the location of the Configuration.mof file:
segment.target: On the Configuration Manager Server, browse to the location of the Configuration.mof file:

segment.source: CMInstallLocationInboxesclifiles.srchinv
segment.target: CMInstallLocationInboxesclifiles.srchinv

segment.source: On a default installation, the installation location is %systemdrive%Program Files Microsoft Configuration Manager.
segment.target: On a default installation, the installation location is %systemdrive%Program Files Microsoft Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Edit the Configuration.mof file to append the following MBAM classes:
segment.target: Edit the Configuration.mof file to append the following MBAM classes:

segment.source: To edit the Configuration.mof file for Configuration Manager 2007
segment.target: To edit the Configuration.mof file for Configuration Manager 2007

segment.source: On the Configuration Manager Server, browse to the location of the Configuration.mof file:
segment.target: On the Configuration Manager Server, browse to the location of the Configuration.mof file:

segment.source: CMInstallLocationInboxesclifiles.srchinv
segment.target: CMInstallLocationInboxesclifiles.srchinv

segment.source: On a default installation, the installation location is %systemdrive%Program Files (x86)Microsoft Configuration Manager.
segment.target: On a default installation, the installation location is %systemdrive%Program Files (x86)Microsoft Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Edit the Configuration.mof file to append the following MBAM classes:
segment.target: Edit the Configuration.mof file to append the following MBAM classes:
